author: Megan Doherty
title: Join the Great Big Bulb Dig at Floriade 2024 | The Canberra Times | Canberra, ACT
text: Floriade still has a way to go, but don't miss your chance to dig up a part of it, to take home for your own garden, to enjoy next spring.The Great Big Bulb Dig is back.It will be held at Commonwealth Park on Monday, October 14, the day after Floriade closes its gates for 2024.\u003cbr\u003eTo participate, you have to buy the 2024 bag - you can't use ones from previous years or bring in random bags.The official 2024 Floriade Art in Bloom Great Big Bulb Dig bags are available during Floriade from the Floriade Shop, the on-site information tent, the Synergy Group Kombi van or the charity marquees.All proceeds from the sale of the bags go to charity - this year Roundabout Canberra and the Indigenous Marathon Foundation.This year sees the return of the $15 bag and there are still plenty to purchase. The more bags you buy, the more bulbs you can take home.But special, bigger VIP bags for $30 were also introduced this year - and they have already sold out. The VIP bag holders also get access to the site at 10am - an hour earlier than the regular bag holders, who will be able to start digging from 11am.Canberra professional services firm Synergy Group is the major sponsor of Floriade again and the brains behind the Great Big Bulb Dig, which is now in its third year.Synergy Group CEO Rob Kennedy loves Floriade, loves spring in Canberra and loves helping local charities.And he's been blown away by the popularity of the Great Big Bulb Dig.The Great Big Bulb Dig has each year raised more than $60,000 for charity. And it is on track to do the same this year, bolstered also by coffee sales from the Synergy Group Kombi, which is on-site in Commonwealth Park during Floriade.\u003cbr\u003eThe coffee van is staffed by Synergy staff and volunteers from Roundabout Canberra and the Indigenous Marathon Foundation.\u003cb\u003eWHAT: \u003c/b\u003eThe Great Big Bulb Dig , Floriade, Commonwealth Park\u003cb\u003eWHEN:\u003c/b\u003e Monday, October 14. 10am for $30 VIP bag holders (sold out) and 11am for $15 regular bag holders. Last entry 5.30pm.\u003cb\u003eWHERE DO I BUY A BAG: \u003c/b\u003e the Floriade Shop, on-site information tent, Synergy Group Kombi van or charity marquees during Floriade\u003cb\u003e\u003c/b\u003e\u003cb\u003eBRING:\u003c/b\u003e Shovels, garden forks, secateurs\u003cb\u003eDON'T BRING: \u003c/b\u003eTrailers, wheelbarrows, unofficial bags

author: Peter Helman
title: Ariana Grande’s First New Solo Music in 3 Years Coming This Week
text: Ariana Grande is returning with her first new solo music in over three years. The pop star took to Instagram to officially announce her new single "Yes, And?" on Sunday, revealing that it will be available to purchase and stream this coming Friday, Jan. 12. "yes, and? ♡ 1.12,” Grande wrote alongside a blurry close-up of her face wearing red lipstick, which appears to be the song's cover artwork. Although she has appeared on collaborations and remixes with artists including Kelly Clarkson, Doja Cat and the Weeknd, Grande has not released any solo music since Positions in October 2020. In the meantime, she has focused on her R.E.M. Beauty brand and her starring role as Glinda in John Chu's upcoming Wicked films. Late last year, Grande [confirmed that her long-awaited seventh album](https://themessenger.com/entertainment/ariana-grande-teases-new-music-see-you-next-year-wicked-studio), which she worked on with longtime collaborators Max Martin and Ilya Salmanzadeh, would be out in 2024. "See you next year," she wrote on social media. [Ariana Grande Teases New Music Once Again: ‘See You Next Year’](/entertainment/ariana-grande-teases-new-music-see-you-next-year-wicked-studio?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [Ariana Grande Is Back in the Recording Studio, Teases New Music](/entertainment/ariana-grande-teases-new-music-back-in-recording-studio-photos?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [Ariana Grande and Ethan Slater Pose Backstage Together at Broadway Musical](/entertainment/ariana-grande-ethan-slater-photographed-instagram-broadway?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [Ariana Grande’s New Boyfriend Ethan Slater Files for Divorce From Wife: Report](/entertainment/ariana-grandes-new-boyfriend-ethan-slater-files-for-divorce-from-wife-report?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [Ariana Grande and Dalton Gomez Signed Prenup, New Court Documents Reveal](/entertainment/ariana-grande-dalton-gomez-signed-prenup-court-documents-reveal?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [Ariana Grande and Dalton Gomez Both File for Divorce](/entertainment/ariana-grande-husband-dalton-gomez-file-for-divorce?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) Just before the new year, she [posted a lengthy statement reflecting on her 2023](https://themessenger.com/entertainment/ariana-grande-most-challenging-yet-happiest-year-ethan-slater-romance), which she described as "one of the most transformative, most challenging, and yet happiest and most special years of my life.” "There were so many beautiful and yet polarized feelings," Grande wrote. "I've never felt more at the mercy of and in acceptance of what life was screaming to teach me. I've never felt more fulfilled by or present in my work, being able to cherish every moment." "I gave everything I could have possibly given of my heart and of myself to the projects I was fortunate enough to be a part of and learned so much from every brilliant, beautiful soul that I had the privilege of creating art with and crossing paths with this year." author: VNExplorer
title: El actuar que salvó la vida de todos los ocupantes del tren EFE en el accidente ferroviario
text: El actuar que salvó la vida de todos los ocupantes del tren EFE en el accidente ferroviario El testimonio de un testigo permitió establecer cómo fue posible salvar la vida de todos los ocupantes del tren EFE que participó del accidente ferroviario ocurrido la madrugada del jueves en San Bernardo. El suceso ocurrió cuando dos trenes, uno de EFE y otro de la empresa Fepasa, colisionaron frontalmente debido a que, por causas que se investigan, transitaban por la misma vía. Por ello, la Fiscalía Occidente indaga el hecho junto con Carabineros, para establecer si hay responsabilidades penales en este incidente quedó dos muertos. Se trata de los dos ocupantes del tren Fepasa, los trabajadores Daniel Vega y José Bonín. Actualmente, hay dos detenidos por este caso por el cargo de cuasidelito de homicidio, ambos empleados de EFE. Se trata del encargado de control de la vía férrea y el maquinista del tren accidentado, quien se encontraba realizando un viaje de prueba de velocidad. Este último logró salvar la vida de todos los ocupantes del tren que encabezaba, que junto a él eran nueve, entre ellos cuatro ciudadanos chinos. Así lo relató uno de los ocupantes de la máquina, según informó El Mercurio, quien señaló que el viaje de prueba era controlado por el Puesto de Comando Centralizado (PCC). “Llegamos a la altura de la comuna de Buin, cuando a eso de las 23:30 horas aproximadamente, vía radial, PCC dispuso al maquinista que debíamos hacer un cambio de vía a la número 2, pista en la cual hicimos una prueba completa”, declaró. Luego, señaló que “cuando pasamos a hacer la segunda prueba en la vía 2 íbamos a una velocidad aproximada de 120 kilómetros por hora, y a eso de las 00:00 o pasada la medianoche, observamos que aparecen las luces del tren e indico ‘este tren viene por nuestra vía"”. El aviso que salvó la vida de todos El testimonio de este testigo continuó señalando que “seguíamos en la cabina, el maquinista mantuvo la velocidad y así nos mantuvimos por unos segundos, cuando justo en ese momento el maquinista dice ‘arranquen"”. Dicha advertencia salvó la vida de los nueve ocupantes, dijo el fiscal de Flagrancia Occidente, Pedro Aravena. “Rápidamente, les dije a las personas que estaban en el salón que nos trasladáramos lo más atrás posible del vagón. No me di cuenta si el maquinista accionó el freno de emergencia, pero imagino que lo hizo, porque es el protocolo que hay que hacer antes de abandonar la cabina”, expresó. Tanto el maquinista como el encargado de control serán formalizados este sábado, luego que la Fiscalía Occidente solicitara ampliar la detención.

author: La rédaction avec AFP
title: VIDEO. Expulsion d'un imam accusé d'appel à la haine : "Je suis là pour me battre"... Mahjoub Mahjoubi peut-il réellement "regagner la France" ? - ladepeche.fr
text:
Accusé d'avoir proféré dans des prêches des appels à la haine visant les femmes, les Juifs ou une société française "pourrie", l'imam tunisien de la mosquée de Bagnols-sur-Cèze (Gard) Mahjoub Mahjoubi a été arrêté le 22 février à son domicile et expulsé vers la Tunisie quelques heures plus tard.
A lire aussi : L'imam du Gard Mahjoub Mahjoubi expulsé vers la Tunisie "moins de 12 heures après son interpellation", se félicite Gérald Darmanin
Comment Mahjoub Mahjoubi a été expulsé Arrêté sur la base d'un arrêté ministériel d'expulsion, en présence de ses enfants et de son épouse selon son avocat Samir Hamroun, l'imam tunisien a été transféré vers un centre de rétention administrative (CRA) en région parisienne. Dans un message posté sur X (anciennement Twitter), le ministre de l'Intérieur Gérald Darmanin a annoncé son expulsion effective "moins de 12 heures après son interpellation".
« L’Imam » radical Mahjoub Mahjoubi vient d’être expulsé du territoire national, moins de 12h après son interpellation.
C’est la démonstration que la loi Immigration, sans laquelle une telle expulsion aussi rapide n’aurait pas été possible, rend la France plus forte. Nous ne…
— Gérald DARMANIN (@GDarmanin) February 22, 2024 "C'est la démonstration que la loi immigration, sans laquelle une telle expulsion aussi rapide n'aurait pas été possible, rend la France plus forte", a-t-il ajouté, "nous ne laisserons rien passer".
Installé en France depuis le milieu des années 1980, père de quatre enfants, Mahjoub Mahjoubi a "fait l'objet d'une visite domiciliaire et d'une interpellation", avait précisé plutôt dans la journée sur X Gérald Darmanin, qui avait réclamé dimanche le retrait de son titre de séjour. Le ministre a à nouveau fustigé jeudi un "'imam' radical aux propos inacceptables".
Instruction a été donnée de prendre un arrêté ministériel d’expulsion contre cet « imam » radical aux propos inacceptables et il a fait l’objet d’une visite domiciliaire et d’une interpellation.
Sans la loi immigration, cela n’aurait pas pu être possible. La fermeté est la… https://t.co/uTJG2YbpQ5
— Gérald DARMANIN (@GDarmanin) February 22, 2024 En plus d'enclencher la procédure d'expulsion, M. Darmanin avait demandé au préfet de signaler ces propos à la justice. La procureure de Nîmes Cécile Gensac avait annoncé lundi avoir ouvert une enquête préliminaire pour "apologie du terrorisme"
A lire aussi : Imam du Gard accusé de prêche anti-France : Mahjoub Mahjoubi placé en centre de rétention, un arrêté d'expulsion lui a été remis ce matin
Quels faits lui sont reprochés Mahjoub Mahjoubi s'était fait connaître il y a quelques jours pour une vidéo circulant sur les réseaux sociaux dans laquelle il qualifiait le "drapeau tricolore" - sans préciser s'il s'agissait du drapeau français - de "drapeau satanique" qui n'aurait "aucune valeur auprès d'Allah". Il s'était défendu lundi en évoquant un "lapsus", expliquant qu'il dénonçait en réalité les rivalités entre supporters des pays du Maghreb lors de la récente Coupe d'Afrique des nations de football.
A lire aussi : VIDEO. Imam du Gard menacé d'expulsion : "Je ne parlais en aucun cas du drapeau français", plaide Mahjoub Mahjoubi
Dans des prêches des semaines précédentes, Mahjoub Mahjoubi "a véhiculé une conception littérale, rétrograde, intolérante et violente de l'islam, de nature à encourager (...) la discrimination à l'égard des femmes, (...) les tensions avec la communauté juive et la radicalisation jihadiste", relève l'arrêté. Si l'on en croit l'arrêté d'expulsion, les propos reprochés à l'imam tunisien couvrent un champ bien plus large que le débat autour du drapeau. Les autorités françaises accusent aussi l'imam de "propos haineux et discriminatoires à l'égard des non-musulmans et de la société française" qu'il aurait décrite comme "belliqueuse et pourrie".
Est-ce qu'il pourrait revenir en France L'avocat de Mahjoub Mahjoubi, Samir Hamroun, a dit jeudi à l'AFP qu'il allait contester son expulsion: "pour la requête en référé, c'est le juge des libertés et de la détention du tribunal de Meaux qui est compétent". "Pour le fond 'Il a dit ci, il a pas dit ça..', ça sera devant le tribunal administratif de Paris", a ajouté l'avocat, selon qui son client est "abasourdi" et "bouleversé".
\ud83d\udde8 "Je vais tout faire pour regagner la France"
Expulsé vers la Tunisie, l'imam Mahjoubi réagit sur @BFMTV pic.twitter.com/U5FEPRI4Mh
— BFMTV (@BFMTV) February 23, 2024 Arrivé en Tunisie, l'imam a expliqué vouloir "tout faire pour regagner la France". "Je suis là pour me battre et faire valoir mes droits", a-t-il assuré.

author: BL New Delhi Bureau
title: PM opens Sela tunnel that eases connectivity to Arunachal Pradesh close to China border - The Hindu BusinessLine
text:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday inaugurated the strategic all-weather Sela Tunnel that connects Tezpur in Assam to Tawang in the West Kameng district of Arunachal Pradesh, close to China border.
Also read: Bichom becomes 27th district of Arunachal Pradesh
The tunnel, situated at an altitude of 13,000 feet, is an engineering marvel constructed by the Border Roads Organisation (BRO) at a cost of ₹825 crore. It will reduce the travel time by an hour.
Speaking on the occasion, the Ministry of Defence stated that the Prime Minister criticised previous regimes for neglecting the development of the border villages. Modi said his work style is driven by the needs of the nation and not for electoral considerations.
He promised the defence personnel that he would come to meet them at this engineering marvel in his next term. Modi also voiced the Government’s unwavering commitment to the development of the Northeast region.
The tunnel will provide all-weather connectivity to Tawang across Sela Pass on the Balipara - Chariduar - Tawang Road, boosting the preparedness of the Armed Forces and augmenting the socio-economic development of the border region.
Work on many tunnels is going on in the region, the PM added. The Tunnel has been constructed using the new Austrian tunnelling method and incorporates safety features of the highest standards.
Also read: Tezu Airport to be re-inaugurated on September 24
The tunnel has been completed in five years, as the foundation stone for construction was laid by the PM on February 09, 2019 and now, it has been opened, overcoming challenges of difficult terrain and adverse weather conditions, the MoD stated.
In the last three years, the BRO has completed a record 330 infrastructure projects at the cost of ₹8,737 crore.

author: @WSMV
title: TN legislature passes new nearly $60 billion budget
text:
TN legislature passes new nearly $60 billion budget
The House and Senate passed a $59.8 billion budget for the 2025-26 fiscal year.
NASHVILLE, Tenn. (WSMV) - The Tennessee General Assembly announced it has passed the state’s nearly $60 billion budget on Wednesday.
The House and Senate passed a $59.8 billion budget for the 2025-26 fiscal year.
The new spending plan shows a 2% growth rate with efforts to improve public safety, invest in infrastructure, advance education, and more, according to Republican legislators.
“The legislative amendment makes fiscally responsible adjustments to the administration’s initial budget proposal by shifting $19.94 million in recurring allocations to non-recurring, allowing the state to better manage long-term spending obligations,” Republicans said.
Below is a look at the budget breakdown from state Republicans:
Grant Pool for Community Services
In the budget, a $42.5 million grant pool was created, with nonrecurring funds, for important emergency and community services. The grants include:
- $20 million for Volunteer Fire Departments
- $5 million for Rescue Squads
- $5 million for Emergency Medical Services
- $5 million for Senior Centers
- $5 million for Local Museums for capital improvements
- $2 million for Courthouse Restoration
- $500,000 for Second Harvest Food Bank
Disaster Relief for Hurricane Helene
Hurricane Helene victims were provided $26 million nonrecurring for disaster relief in Northeast Tennessee and $20 million nonrecurring for local match funds for FEMA disaster relief.
Rural Hospital Support and Healthcare Investments
Lawmakers used TennCare Shared Savings to provide an additional $78 million to help hospitals, particularly in rural areas, with uncompensated care and $4 million to complete capital projects at county health departments.
Additional healthcare investments include:
- $4 million recurring to increase pediatric dental rates
- $3 million nonrecurring to the Adult Healthcare Safety Net
- $500,000 nonrecurring to assist those living with epilepsy and their caregivers statewide
- $1.4 million recurring to provide scholarships for the joint public-private partnership in the Medical School Early Acceptance Program between MTSU and Meharry Medical College
- $1 million nonrecurring to Live Like Lou Foundation for ALS research
- $1 million nonrecurring for Volunteers in Medicine
Safety and Security Improvements
The budget also provides additional allocations in safety and security:
- $5.4 million nonrecurring to improve campus safety and security at the University of Memphis
- $500,000 nonrecurring to establish and operate the UT Law Enforcement Innovation Center
- $400,000 nonrecurring to support the East Tennessee Regional Forensic Facility and Training Program
Major investments secured
In addition to the adjustments made to fund legislative priorities, the budget maintains investments proposed by Gov. Lee including:
- $1 billion into the road fund to address the state’s transportation infrastructure needs
- $62.7 million for K-12 infrastructure and facilities funding
- $244 million to strengthen education through the Tennessee Investment in Student Achievement (TISA) formula growth, including teacher pay raises
- $198.4 million for teacher bonuses in recognition of their hard work and dedication and for leading the nation in student achievement and growth
- $35.6 million investment into the Rainy Day Fund, bringing Tennessee’s reserves to nearly $2.2 billion, the largest in state history
- $25 million for FastTrack grants to recruit new business to Tennessee and support workforce development
Expanding choices for parents
The special session-passed school choice bill initiative invests $145.9 million in Education Freedom Scholarships.
WSMV4 has reached out to state democrats for a response to the budget. We have yet to hear back by the time of this article’s publishing.
